Chin Lift and Control of Breathing

When there is a suspected neck injury, open the airway using the jaw-thrust maneuver. Be aware that maintenance of a patent airway and adequate ventilation are of the utmost importance in a patient with a suspected spinal neck injury.

If the jaw-thrust maneuver is not successful, apply just enough head tilt maneuver to open the airway. Meantime, the head is manually stabilized to minimize movements of the head in order to protect the cervical spine when oxygenation and ventilation are not at risk.

During recovery, breathing should be assessed every minute.
